item.title: 联合国原子能机构否认为以色列袭击伊朗提供掩护
item.description: 联合国原子能监察机构负责人驳斥了伊朗的指控，即最近一份确定德黑兰违反其法律义务的核检查报告 "以任何方式 "为以色列对伊斯兰共和国的攻击提供了理由。【原文：The chief of the United Nations atomic watchdog rejected Iranian allegations that a recent nuclear-inspections report, which determined Tehran is in breach of its legal obligations, “in any way” justified Israel’s attacks on the Islamic Republic.】

item.title: 西班牙热浪考验电网在停电后转向天然气的能力
item.description: 在西班牙发生大停电事故后，该国电网加强了对天然气发电的依赖，因此家庭降温用电需求的增加给能源价格带来了压力。【原文：Increasing power demand to cool homes in Spain is putting pressure on energy prices after the country’s grid boosted its reliance on gas generation in the wake of a massive blackout.】

item.title: 备受争议的英国油田获得新的环境许可指南
item.description: 在政府就如何评估化石燃料项目对气候的影响发布指导意见之后，由 Equinor ASA 公司和壳牌石油公司（Shell Plc —）牵头的英国两个备受争议的油气田现在将有机会重新申请环境许可证。【原文：Two controversial oil and gas fields in the UK — led by Equinor ASA and Shell Plc — will now have the opportunity to re-apply for environmental permits after the government published a guidance on how it will asses the climate impact of fossil fuel projects.】

item.title: 萨默斯认为特朗普将任命 "受人尊敬的 "鲍威尔继任者
item.description: 前财政部长劳伦斯-萨默斯（Lawrence Summers）表示，尽管唐纳德-特朗普抨击美国央行行长杰罗姆-鲍威尔今年未能降息，但他预计唐纳德-特朗普将提名一位主流候选人接替美联储主席鲍威尔。【原文：Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said he expects Donald Trump to name a mainstream candidate to replace Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, despite the president’s bashing of the US central bank leader for failing to cut interest rates this year.】

item.title: 意外之财征税占英国石油公司 2024 年英国税单的三分之一
item.description: 英国石油公司将在 2024 年向英国政府缴纳 12.5 亿英镑（约合 16 亿美元）的税款，其中约三分之一的税款来自于英国的暴利税。【原文：BP Plc paid £1.25 billion ($1.6 billion) in taxes to the UK government in 2024, with about a third of the payments a result of the country’s windfall charge.】

item.title: 受热浪影响，法国电力公司可能从 6 月 25 日起限制法国核电产量
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）表示，由于用于冷却部分反应堆的罗讷河温度升高，一场蔓延全国的热浪可能迫使该公司从 6 月 25 日起减少核电输出。【原文：Electricite de France SA said a heat wave that’s spreading across the country may force it to curb nuclear output from June 25 due to the rising temperature of the Rhone river that’s used for cooling some of its reactors.】

item.title: 中东金融家越来越担心美国可能打击伊朗
item.description: 即使在 2023 年开始的地区冲突的背景下，中东的主要商业中心仍然有源源不断的金融工作者和公司涌入，因为最富裕的海湾石油国家在很大程度上仍然与外界隔绝。【原文：Even against the backdrop of a regional conflict that began in 2023, the Middle East’s main business hubs saw a steady stream of financial workers and firms because the wealthiest Gulf petrostates remained largely insulated.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织敲响欧元区经济增长停滞警钟
item.description: 国际货币基金组织警告说，如果不采取紧急行动解决增长放缓、投资疲软和地缘政治威胁上升等问题，欧洲就有可能陷入停滞。【原文：Europe risks drifting into stagnation without urgent action to tackle slowing growth, weak investment and rising geopolitical threats, the International Monetary Fund warned.】

item.title: 西班牙监管机构修订电网电压控制规则
item.description: 西班牙市场监管机构批准修订旨在保持该国电网电压稳定的规则，其中许多规则已有 25 年历史。【原文：Spain’s markets regulator approved a revision of rules aimed at keeping voltage on the country’s power grid stable, many of which were 25 years old.】

item.title: 肯尼亚立法者反驳财政部取消部分减税措施的计划
item.description: 肯尼亚立法者以担心通货膨胀和投资者信心下降为由，拒绝了财政部提出的取消一系列商品和服务税收减免的建议。【原文：Kenyan lawmakers turned down Treasury’s proposals to scrap tax breaks on a range of goods and services, citing concerns over inflation and dwindling investor confidence.】

item.title: 瑞银称，瑞士联合银行的政策设置意味着不大可能进行大规模外汇干预
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS）的经济学家认为，即使瑞士法郎的强势将利率推至零，瑞士国家银行也不太可能对其进行大规模干预。【原文：Large-scale interventions in the franc by the Swiss National Bank are unlikely even though the currency’s strength pushed interest rates to zero, according to economists at UBS.】

item.title: 六日停战后埃及恢复从以色列进口天然气
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士称，埃及开始从以色列接收少量天然气，结束了中断六天的天然气供应。【原文：Egypt started to receive small quantities of natural gas from Israel, ending a six-day halt in supplies, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 印度当局继续进行坠机调查和记录仪分析
item.description: 上周，印度航空公司一架客机在起飞后不久坠毁在一个人口稠密的城市，造成波音公司 787 客机上几乎所有人丧生。【原文：India’s Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau is progressing with its probe into the possible cause of the deadly crash last week involving an Air India airliner, which smashed into a densely populated city shortly after takeoff, killing almost everyone on board the Boeing Co. 787.】

item.title: 南非央行称南非银行面临贸易和战争冲击的风险
item.description: 南非央行表示，日益紧张的地缘政治局势和全球政策的不确定性是南非金融业面临的最大风险之一。【原文：Growing geopolitical tensions and global policy uncertainty are among the biggest risks facing South Africa’s financial industry, the central bank said.】

item.title: 巴里克在马里的未来取决于关键金矿许可证的续期
item.description: 巴里克矿业公司（Barrick Mining Corp. ）在马里的传奇故事的下一个主要障碍将是续签一个关键的金矿开采许可证，此前马里政府本周暂时接管了庞大的卢洛-古恩科托（Loulo-Gounkoto）矿区。【原文：One of the next major hurdles in Barrick Mining Corp.’s saga in Mali will be renewing a key gold mining license, after the state temporarily took over the vast Loulo-Gounkoto complex this week.】

item.title: 经济放缓，俄罗斯顶级钢铁制造商面临停产风险
item.description: 谢韦尔钢铁股份公司（Severstal PJSC）负责人表示，由于经济疲软导致建筑业放缓，俄罗斯钢铁需求下滑，这可能会迫使该国部分生产商停止生产。【原文：Slumping Russian steel demand, due to a construction slowdown amid broader economic weakness, may force some of the country’s producers to halt output, according to Severstal PJSC’s chief.】

item.title: 雨水提高产量，津巴布韦烟草销量跃升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于降雨量的增加帮助提高了非洲第一大烟草生产国的烟草产量，津巴布韦的烟草销量飙升至创纪录水平。【原文：Zimbabwe’s tobacco sales surged to a record as improved rainfall helped boost output in Africa’s top producer of the crop.】

item.title: 6.5 万亿美元的 "三重巫术 "预示着波动性的回归
item.description: 投资者正在为周五到期的 6.5 万亿美元名义上的美国期权做好准备，此举可能会使股市出现比最近几周的低迷变化更为剧烈的波动。【原文：Investors are bracing for $6.5 trillion of notional US options expiring on Friday, in a move that could free stocks to swing more wildly than the subdued changes seen in recent weeks.】

item.title: 干风来临，加州公用事业公司考虑停电
item.description: 由于全州微风干燥，野火风险上升，加州公用事业公司正在酝酿停电。【原文：California utilities are mulling power shutdowns as breezy dry conditions across the state raise the risk of wildfires.】

item.title: 如果霍尔木兹海峡被封锁，印度可能减少石油产品出口
item.description: 印度石油部长哈迪普-普里（Hardeep Puri）周四表示，印度正准备从波斯湾以外地区采购原油，并在霍尔木兹海峡船舶运输受阻的情况下减少本国的成品油出口。【原文：India is preparing to source crude oil from outside the Persian Gulf and cut its own refined-product exports should the Strait of Hormuz be blocked to ship traffic, Oil Minister Hardeep Puri said Thursday.】

item.title: 美国考虑打击伊朗，石油面临更大风险溢价
item.description: 随着美国与以色列联手轰炸伊朗的前景日益逼近，石油观察家们正在重新评估他们应该给予全球原油市场的风险溢价。【原文：Oil watchers are re-evaluating the risk premium they should place on the global crude market, with the prospect of the US joining Israel in bombing Iran looming.】

item.title: 沙特人工智能公司 Humain 成立专注于广告和游戏的部门
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯新成立的人工智能公司 Humain 已经组建了一个部门，从事广告、视频游戏和电影方面的工作，沙特阿拉伯正努力成为全球科技领域的领导者。【原文：Saudi Arabia’s new artificial intelligence company, Humain, has formed a division to work on advertising, video games and film, as the kingdom strives to become a global leader in technology.】

item.title: 蒙特利尔银行收购 Burgundy Asset 以加强财富管理业务
item.description: 蒙特利尔银行正在收购勃艮第资产管理有限公司（Burgundy Asset Management Ltd.），通过增加一家为富裕人士、养老金和基金会管理资金的加拿大老牌公司来加强其财富管理部门。【原文：Bank of Montreal is buying Burgundy Asset Management Ltd., bolstering its wealth management unit by adding an established Canadian firm that manages money for affluent individuals, pensions and foundations.】

item.title: 监督机构敦促加拿大向更多外国资本开放航空业
item.description: 加拿大竞争监督机构称，加拿大应放宽对航空公司的投资规定，允许外资完全控股只在国内市场飞行的航空公司。【原文：Canada should loosen investment rules for airlines to allow full foreign ownership of carriers that fly only within the domestic market, according to the country’s competition watchdog.】

item.title: 中东战争促使亚洲天然气买家考虑 B 计划
item.description:
一个推动液化天然气增长的地区可能开始转向替代品。【原文：

A region that’s driving LNG growth may begin turning to alternatives.

】

item.title: 欧洲三次降息寻求遏制美国关税动荡
item.description: 欧洲各国央行在短短 24 小时内三次降息，凸显了货币官员寻求控制唐纳德-特朗普不可预测的贸易政策所带来的影响的转变。【原文：Three interest-rate cuts in just over 24 hours by central banks in Europe highlighted a shift as monetary officials seek to manage the fallout from Donald Trump’s unpredictable trade policies.】

item.title: 香港建筑商新世界接近达成 110 亿美元贷款再融资协议
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，香港负债最多的建筑商之一新世界发展有限公司（New World Development Co.【原文：New World Development Co., one of Hong Kong’s most indebted builders, is close to securing a crucial HK$87.5 billion ($11.1 billion) loan refinancing deal, according to people familiar with the matter, the culmination of months of negotiations as it raced to secure a lifeline amid a deepening liquidity crisis.】

item.title: 英国未来 10 年将在基础设施领域投资 7,250 亿英镑
item.description: 作为英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）推动利用投资拉动经济增长并重新赢得选民支持的努力的一部分，英国政府概述了在未来 10 年内至少斥资 7,250 亿英镑（9,740 亿美元）建设该国岌岌可危的基础设施的计划。【原文：The UK government outlined plans to spend at least £725 billion ($974 billion) on the country’s creaking infrastructure over the next 10 years, as part of Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s push to use investment to lift economic growth and win back support from the electorate.】

item.title: 美联储等待时机确定谁来支付关税
item.description: 我是克里斯-安斯蒂，波士顿的经济编辑。今天我们关注美联储不愿降息的问题。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at the Fed’s reluctance to cut rates. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: 对美达推进人工智能的怀疑提高了招聘人才的成本
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，我们的每日时事通讯提供彭博社全球记者对科技商业的报道和分析。今天，莱利-格里芬（Riley Griffin）将报道 Meta Platform Inc.【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Riley Griffin reports on Meta Platform Inc.’s costly efforts to recruit talent for its artificial intelligence program.】
